result.execSummary:
The defendant Babi R Thomas-Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, schooling, or community service as deemed by the agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with the victim store Walgreens.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Review hearing at 11-24-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Babi R Thomas-Moore in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Defendant Babi R Thomas-Moore in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch for Chris Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT, reinstate bond.
Def has tried to review the evaluation with the deft.
The deft does not want atty Severino to represent her any more.
The deft has not indicated whether or not she agrees with the report.
Def counsel agrees with the report, the deft is not competent at this time.
State would stipulate to the findings in the report.
State will work with Corp Counsel.
BTC: The Court will not permit atty to w/draw at this time. The Court will make a finding the deft is not competent to stand trial. Proceedings are suspended.
  Review hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Babi R Thomas-Moore

Status conference on August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 6, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim store Walgreens or any Walgreens stores except for restitution purposes.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Babi R Thomas-Moore in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Defendant Babi R Thomas-Moore in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
